From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Ochs (regional or poetic)

Etymology

[edit]

    Inherited from Middle High German ohse, from Old High German ohso, from Proto-West Germanic *ohsō, from Proto-Germanic *uhsô, from Proto-Indo-European *uksḗn.

    Cognate with Dutch os, West Frisian okse, Saterland Frisian Okse, Low German Oss, Plautdietsch Oss, Yiddish אָקס (oks), Icelandic oxi and uxi, Faroese oksi, Norwegian Bokmål okse, Norwegian Nynorsk okse, Swedish oxe, Danish okse, and English ox.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈɔk.sə/
    • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

    Noun

    [edit]

    Ochse m (weak, genitive Ochsen, plural Ochsen, diminutive Öchslein n or Öchschen n)

    1. ox (castrated bull; castrated male bovine animal)

    Declension

    [edit]
    Declension of Ochse [masculine, weak]
    singular plural
    indef. def. noun def. noun
    nominative ein der Ochse die Ochsen
    genitive eines des Ochsen der Ochsen
    dative einem dem Ochsen den Ochsen
    accusative einen den Ochsen die Ochsen

    Related terms

    [edit]
    • Auerochse, Grunzochse, Hornochse, Moschusochse, Zugochse

    Related terms

    [edit]
    • Ochsenauge
    • Ochsenblut
    • Ochsenfleisch
    • Ochsengespann
    • Ochsenkarren
    • Ochsenknecht
    • Ochsenkopf
    • Ochsenring
    • Ochsenschlepp
    • Ochsenschwanz
    • Ochsenschwanzsuppe
    • Ochsenstachel
    • Ochsenziemer
    • Ochsenzunge

    Descendants

    [edit]
    • → Luxembourgish: Ochs

    See also

    [edit]
    • Rind
    • Kuh
    • Bulle; Stier
    • schauen wie der Ochs vorm Berg

    Further reading

    [edit]
    • “Ochse” in Duden online
    • “Ochse” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache

    Hunsrik

    [edit]

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈoksə/
    • Rhymes: -oksə
    • Syllabification: Och‧se

    Noun

    [edit]

    Ochse m

    1. plural of Ochs
